events.title: Italy Shifts Command in Libya: General Bastico Takes Lead to Boost Morale and Assert Influence
events.description: 26. The enemy also undertook the reorganisation of his forces in North Africa during this period. On the 19th July General Ettore Bastico took over the Supreme Command in Libya from General Garibaldi. It is probable that the appointment of General Bastico, a reported expert on mechanised warfare, was intended as much to show that Italian interests in Libya were at least equal to German interests in Libya as to reorganise the Italian forces and revive their morale.
